content:
Hi all. I have a colleague who is looking to hire a research scientist with experience in semantic modeling (knowledge graphs, ontologies) and related areas of natural language processing. The employer is also open to category theory, although not deeply involved themselves.

If you or someone you know has a background in these areas and might be interested, send me a private message and I can pass on your information. Thanks!

Following up on my previous post, this would be an implementation-oriented position. If your (friend's) CV/resume/website doesn't prominently display programming expertise and experience, please include that as well. Also useful would be any prior experience working with graph databases, RDF/OWL or semantic analysis in NLP (e.g., word2vec, DisCoCat).
